title: Frontend Framework Selection Decision Required
question: Which frontend framework (React vs Vue.js vs Svelte) should we use for the mobile-first PWA ERP system?

context.primary_user: Business owner on mobile phone (90% of operations)
critical_requirements: Record sale in < 30 seconds on mobile

options.name: Vue.js 3
pros: Smallest bundle of major frameworks (40% smaller than React)
Template syntax similar to Django templates (familiar to Python developers)
Simple state management with Pinia (much simpler than Redux)
Vuetify 3 and Quasar provide mature mobile-optimized components
Proven in production for 10+ years (Alibaba, Xiaomi, Adobe, GitLab)
Best development experience with Vite (fastest HMR)
cons: Smaller ecosystem than React (but sufficient for ERP needs)
Less job market presence than React (but not relevant for in-house team)
options.timeline_impact: Achievable in 3 months with 1 week buffer

risks.mitigation: All required ERP libraries available (charts, forms, data grids, mobile UI)

options.name: React 18
pros: Best job market (highest demand for React developers)
cons: Large bundle size (165-200KB) makes < 3 second load challenging
Steep learning curve for Django developers (JSX, hooks, Redux)
Requires manual optimization for mobile performance
More boilerplate code than Vue or Svelte
Complex state management (Redux) has steep learning curve
Configuration fatigue (many choices for routing, state, styling)
options.timeline_impact: Achievable in 3 months but tight (requires optimization work)

risks.mitigation: Aggressive code splitting, lazy loading, optimization work (+1-2 weeks)
Simpler state management (Zustand), training time in Sprint 1

options.name: Svelte 5
pros: Smallest bundle size (15-25KB) - 3x smaller than Vue, 10x smaller than React
Best runtime performance (no virtual DOM overhead)
Built-in state management (no external libraries needed)
Excellent developer experience (less code to write)
cons: Smallest ecosystem of the three frameworks
Fewer mobile UI component libraries (may need custom components)
Less mature PWA tooling (no Svelte-specific PWA plugin)
Fewer documented PWA patterns and examples
Smaller community (30K Stack Overflow questions vs 250K+ for Vue)
Timeline risk - immature ecosystem may slow development

risks.mitigation: Evaluate all required libraries before committing, use vanilla JS libraries, build custom components (+2-3 weeks)
Thorough evaluation of UI libraries, build custom mobile components, extensive testing (+2 weeks)
Strict scope management, early prototype validation, have Vue.js as backup

reasoning: Vue.js 3 offers the best balance across all critical mission requirements
Bundle size (45-60KB) easily achieves < 3 second 4G load without optimization effort
Template syntax similar to Django templates - easiest for Python/Django developers to learn
Mature PWA tooling (@vitejs/plugin-pwa) with excellent documentation
Vuetify 3 and Quasar provide battle-tested mobile-optimized component libraries
Pinia state management is much simpler than Redux, enabling faster development
3-month MVP timeline achievable with buffer time
Proven technology - 10+ years in production, used by major enterprises (Alibaba, Adobe, GitLab)
Best development velocity due to low boilerplate and excellent tooling (Vite)
acceptable_tradeoffs: Slightly larger bundle than Svelte (45-60KB vs 15-25KB), but both easily meet < 3 second requirement
Smaller ecosystem than React, but sufficient for ERP needs (all required libraries available)
Less enterprise adoption than React, but proven in large-scale production worldwide

architectural.if_vuejs: Single File Components with Composition API, Pinia for state, Vue Router for routing. Simple, clean architecture.
architectural.if_react: Component-based with hooks, Zustand/Redux for state, React Router for routing. More complex due to ecosystem choices.
architectural.if_svelte: Compiled components with built-in stores, svelte-routing. Simplest but less standard patterns.

technical.if_vuejs: Excellent mobile performance out of box, mature PWA tooling, fast development with Vite.
technical.if_react: Good performance with optimization, mature PWA tooling, slower development due to boilerplate.
technical.if_svelte: Best mobile performance, less mature PWA tooling, slower development due to custom components.

cost.all_options: No licensing costs - all frameworks are open-source. Development costs determined by team productivity.
cost.vuejs_advantage: Faster development may reduce total hours (1-2 weeks saved vs React, 2-3 weeks saved vs Svelte).

timeline.if_vuejs: 3 months achievable with 1 week buffer (12 weeks total, 3 months = 13 weeks)
timeline.if_react: 3 months achievable but tight (13 weeks total, no buffer)
timeline.if_svelte: 3 months risky (13-14 weeks total, may exceed timeline)

team.if_vuejs: 1-2 weeks training, template syntax familiar to Django developers, simple state management.
team.if_react: 2-3 weeks training, JSX/hooks unfamiliar to Python developers, complex state management.
team.if_svelte: 1-2 weeks training, compiler approach different but simple, built-in state management.

decisions_required.question: Which frontend framework should we select?
information_needed_from_human: Does the development team have existing React/Vue/Svelte experience?
Are there specialized libraries we need that only exist in one framework?
How critical is the < 3 second load requirement (could it be relaxed to 4 seconds)?
Are we willing to build custom mobile components if choosing Svelte?

decisions_required.question: Which mobile UI component library should we use?
options: If React: Material-UI (Recommended), Chakra UI, Ant Design Mobile
If Svelte: Skeleton UI (Recommended), Svelte Materialify
information_needed_from_human: Do you prefer Material Design or custom design system?
Is bundle size a critical concern (Vuetify is ~200KB, Quasar is ~120KB)?

decisions_required.question: Which offline storage strategy should we use?
information_needed_from_human: How much offline data do we need to store (estimate)?
Do we need bi-directional sync or just queue-and-replay?

next_steps_after_decision: Create technical specification for frontend architecture
Begin 1-week team training on selected framework
Test prototype on real mobile devices with 4G connection
